trans-unit.source: Update your Service Fabric development environment | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Update your Service Fabric development environment | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Update your Service Fabric development environment to use the latest runtime, SDK, and tools.
trans-unit.target: Update your Service Fabric development environment to use the latest runtime, SDK, and tools.

trans-unit.source: Update your Service Fabric development environment
trans-unit.target: Update your Service Fabric development environment

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric periodically provides new releases of the runtime, SDK, and tools for use in local development.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric periodically provides new releases of the runtime, SDK, and tools for use in local development.

trans-unit.source: Keeping your local development environment updated with these releases ensures that you always have access to the latest features, bug fixes, and performance improvements when building and testing your applications locally.
trans-unit.target: Keeping your local development environment updated with these releases ensures that you always have access to the latest features, bug fixes, and performance improvements when building and testing your applications locally.

trans-unit.source: Clean up your local cluster
trans-unit.target: Clean up your local cluster

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric does not currently support upgrading the Service Fabric runtime while a local cluster is running.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric does not currently support upgrading the Service Fabric runtime while a local cluster is running.

trans-unit.source: In order to ensure a clean upgrade, it is important to clean up your local cluster first.
trans-unit.target: In order to ensure a clean upgrade, it is important to clean up your local cluster first.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Cleaning your local cluster will remove all deployed applications and their data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Cleaning your local cluster will remove all deployed applications and their data.

trans-unit.source: You can clean your local cluster as follows:
trans-unit.target: You can clean your local cluster as follows:

trans-unit.source: Close all other PowerShell windows and start a new one as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Close all other PowerShell windows and start a new one as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the cluster setup directory with `cd "$env:ProgramW6432\Microsoft SDKs\Service Fabric\ClusterSetup"`
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the cluster setup directory with `cd "$env:ProgramW6432\Microsoft SDKs\Service Fabric\ClusterSetup"`

trans-unit.source: Run `.\CleanCluster.ps1`
trans-unit.target: Run `.\CleanCluster.ps1`

trans-unit.source: Update the runtime, SDK, and tools
trans-unit.target: Update the runtime, SDK, and tools

trans-unit.source: Once you have successfully cleaned up your existing cluster, you can proceed with the upgrade as follows:
trans-unit.target: Once you have successfully cleaned up your existing cluster, you can proceed with the upgrade as follows:

trans-unit.source: Start the Web Platform Installer to [update to the new release][1].
trans-unit.target: Start the Web Platform Installer to [update to the new release][1].

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, start a new PowerShell window as an Administrator and navigate to the cluster setup directory with `cd "$ENV:ProgramFiles\Microsoft SDKs\ServiceFabric\ClusterSetup"`.
trans-unit.target: Upon completion, start a new PowerShell window as an Administrator and navigate to the cluster setup directory with `cd "$ENV:ProgramFiles\Microsoft SDKs\ServiceFabric\ClusterSetup"`.

trans-unit.source: Run `.\DevClusterSetup.ps1` to set up your local cluster.
trans-unit.target: Run `.\DevClusterSetup.ps1` to set up your local cluster.

trans-unit.source: That's it!
trans-unit.target: That's it!

trans-unit.source: You can now start Visual Studio and continue building Service Fabric applications.
trans-unit.target: You can now start Visual Studio and continue building Service Fabric applications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The default project structure has changed in this release.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The default project structure has changed in this release.

trans-unit.source: You should be able to open and run existing projects in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: You should be able to open and run existing projects in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: However, if you encounter any issues with building, deploying, or debugging your applications, consider creating a new project and migrating your code over.
trans-unit.target: However, if you encounter any issues with building, deploying, or debugging your applications, consider creating a new project and migrating your code over.
